intro: Gymnosporia samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan gymnosporia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Savai'i in Samoa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain seeds, typical of the gymnosporia genus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
